questions.question: I earn ………………………. money than my wife.
questions.description: We use less with uncountable nouns and fewer with countable nouns.

questions.question: I have got ………………………… problems than I used to have.
questions.description: We use fewer with plural nouns.

questions.question: Choose the ………………………… of the two evils.
questions.description: Lesser can mean smaller in a rather formal style.

questions.question: The government must take immediate action, lest the problem ……………………….. worse.
questions.description: Lest can be followed by should + infinitive or a subjunctive verb.

questions.question: Let’s take a short break, ………………………?
questions.description: Shall we is used as a question tag after let’s.

questions.question: ‘Let’s go for a walk, shall we?’ Yes, ………………………’
questions.description: Let’s is used in short answers.

questions.question: I don’t let the children …………………………. up late.
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: He worked ………………………….. a driver for five years.
questions.description: As is used to say what function or role a person or thing has.

questions.question: ……………………….. people can learn a foreign language perfectly.
questions.description: Only a few means the same as few. It is more common in an informal style.

questions.question: Cactuses need ……………………….. water.
questions.description: Only a little means the same as little.

questions.question: The play was …………………………. interesting.
questions.description: We cannot use little to modify other adjectives and adverbs.

questions.question: I waited ……………………………… but he didn’t come.
questions.description: We do not normally use long in affirmative clauses.
